==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|こく|がく}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=こくがく}} compound {{m|zh|國學|tr=kwok hæwk||nation + learning}}. Compare modern traditional {{etyl|nan|-}} {{m|zh|國學|tr=kok-ha̍k}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|こくがく|acc=0|acc_ref=NHK,DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|こくがく|kyu=國學}}

# The [[study]] of ancient [[Japan]], particularly the early Japanese classics, such as the ''[[w:Nihon Shoki|Nihon Shoki]]'' and the ''[[w:Kojiki|Kojiki]]''. Arose during the [[w:Edo period|Edo period]] as a move away from the study of China.
#: Note that this term means {{m|en|sinology}} in Chinese contexts.
# [[school|School]]s established in the ''kuni'' or [[province]]s of Japan under the old ''[[w:Ritsuryō|Ritsuryō]]'' system.
# In ancient China, schools established in the [[national]] [[capital]].

====Derived terms====
* {{ja-r|国学者|こくがくしゃ}}: a [[scholar]] of ancient Japanese studies
